divs: sighting detailshave seen these lights now on the nights of january 19th, january 20th, & january 22nd. i really dont want to see them again. i must also note that the area has an extreme amount of both red and white blinking radio\microwave antennas. also, seeing lights through the trees around here will give the illusion of blinking. there also is a fair concentration of oil & gas drilling rigs in the area. the following were not antennas nor was i observing them through trees... and i know for sure these werent drilling rigs. these objects look like planes at first, but under observation move and blink in an irregular fashion, unlike a plane. whatever they are, they scare the crap out of me. i am sure they will be up there again. but im not sticking around to get em on tape. january 19th incident - roughly 8:30 pm driving into mcalester, eastbound on 270 very high in the sky above mcalester i saw something streak across the sky at a high rate of speed. i grew up next to an airport, and this was too high to be traveling that fast. much too high. an airplane has lights flashing at a normal pulsing rate. this thing had both red and white blinking lights pulsing in a most irregular fashion. whatever it was, it was traveling north to south. the event took place in about 5-10 seconds total. january 20th incident - roughly 9:00 pm traveling eastbound on 270, between stuart and arpelar. very high in the sky to the north, saw the same style of blinking red & white lights. the white lights seemed to blink in an irregular pulse in a circular pattern around the red light. the lights would disappear, and then reappear in the same spot in the sky. i put the pedal to the floor and did not look back or up. january 22nd incident - roughly 9:00 to 9:40 pm traveling from south of stuart, through stuart, and then eastbound through arpelar, then to mcalester. was travelling north to stuart, ok. observed the same odd blinking irregular lights but much closer and much brighter, to the north. whatever was emitting them seemed to be on the ground to the north and west of stuart & 270 on top of a hill. if you were not observing it from on top of a hill, you would not of seen it from the highway. i was on a road south of the highway. also, to the south and west of stuart, for a brief moment there were the same type of lights observed just behind a hill there. i tried to get into the small town of stuart as fast as possible. once i got near stuart, i could no longer view either of these objects. i then turned east toward mcalester on 270. i looked up to the north, and noticed something moving in the sky. it kept its distance, but it looked like it moved faster almost to keep pace with me. this really scared me as i felt like i was under the objects observation. i was traveling the speed limit at 65 mph. i kept the object under my observation for roughly 15 miles. it just stayed in the same position in relation to my point of view. meaning, where i went, it went and stayed at a static distance from me. the lights blinked all kinds of weird directions. changing white to red to sometimes orange. also, the object moved vertically up and down whilst traveling horizontally. it would speed up and slow down. i can honestly say, i never wanted to see something like that and i hope i never see it again. once i made it into mcalester, i exited my vehicle and blinking lights caught my eye once again. just above the treetops, to the nne at a distance i can not discern, there appeared whitish orangish lights again. blinking strangely this time back and forth, back and forth. i observed this object for approximately 3 minutes before i had enough and locked myself inside.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Stuart, Arpelar, McAleste
